intro: Lactuca koelzii, commonly known as the Koelz's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has basal leaves that are typically lobed or toothed, and it produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common trait among the genus Lactuca. This species is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
